fields.description:
Such text:
-------
# first (первый)
# second (второй)
# third (третий)
-------
generates three numbered lists instead of one
fields.summary: list items with russian symbols break list

fields.description:
If text effects are sequenced the rendered result can include rendered text effect characters (e.g. '*', '{', '}', or '_'). Take the following lines as an example: {{What}} {{is}} {{wrong}} {{with}} {{this}}? **Anything** **wrong** **with** **this**? __How__ __about__ __this__? {{Or}} __how__ **about** {{combinations}}? The result is (I give the HTML here because I can't apply text effects in JIRA): What {{is}} wrong {{with}} this?
*Anything* *wrong* *with* *this*?
_How_ _about_ _this_?
Or _how_ *about* combinations?
Observations: - With sequenced {{monospaced}} effects only every second is rendered correctly, the others are rendered as is; i.e. with the curly braces. - The **strong** and **italic** effect behave the same: On either side of the effected text one of the text effect characters (i.e. '*' or '_') is rendered. - Sequencing different effects can also result in rendered text effect characters.
fields.summary: faulty rendering of sequenced text effects

fields.description:

fields.summary: Crash on viewing own profile
Inline HTML Macro

fields.description:
Currently, it just gives an error message. It'd be much nicer to have the option to overwrite.

This, of course, may be made irrelevant by the attachment versioning stuff.
fields.summary: Ask if you want to overwrite if attaching file with same name as existing attachment

fields.description:
Need more restore options:

restore from file on server (or URL)
file:///export/home/conflence/backup/....

offline/restore ant task

Present (does restore actually work?):
backup
download file (broken on my instance),
select file you downloaded, for upload
select restore
fields.summary: More Restore options

fields.description:
Not sure how to exactly title this.

Watching people slowly adopt confluence.
I can vision many spaces appearing for different projects.
Being a confluence-admin, I can see all the spaces.
I'd rather see not see all the spaces, but just the spaces that are not conflence-admin.
My spaces should just be non-admin spaces, with an option to show all spaces.
fields.summary: Ability to hide spaces with confluence-admin only permissions

fields.description:
If you link to a page that doesn't exist, [I dont exist|nonexistant], when you click it on it, it takes you to a page to create it.

When you include a page that doesnt exist, you get an error message: "Couldn't find a page to include called: nonexistant". Ideally, it should allow you to create it in a similar way.

This is just a time saver really.
fields.summary: Including a missing page should work like missing links

fields.description:
When I add an inline image to a page, using the 
!http://url_to_image.foo.com! markup, and then export the page into PDF image size changes (increases) and the quality is very bad.
fields.summary: Inline images get garbled when exporting to PDF

fields.description:
Currently you can view the differences between this and the last version (giving you a diff style output).

What would be better is if you could choose two versions and diff between them. (eg: version 3 and version 8)
fields.summary: Show Differences between Separate Versions

fields.description:
It would be extremely useful is it was possible to add comments to changes, to let the author of the changes explain why the changes were made.

Think of it akin to CVS commit messages.
fields.summary: Change Comments

fields.description:
On the profile page where it lists reciently edited pages, I see the time stamps:

Feb 28, 2004 11:48
Feb 28, 2004 07:41

I know 11:48 is am and 07:41 is pm, but anyone else wouldnt. Display of accurate information is critical to knowing when things were edited.
fields.summary: Date / Time display in 12 hour format, without AM/PM

fields.description:
The following page code outputs a table, but the list isnt picked up, and the *'s remain as litteral output:

||Test Table||
|Here is my list \\ * Item A \\ * Item B \\ * Item C|

The following doesnt work either:

||Test Table||
|Here is my list * Item A * Item B * Item C|

The following breaks out the table, but outputs a list:

||Test Table||
|Here is my list
* Item A
* Item B
* Item C|

Just a test to check that numbered lists dont work either:

||Test Table||
|Here is my list \\ # Item A \\ # Item B \\ # Item C|

This functionality gets used in quite alot of our documentation. Currently the * and manual number is ok, but it would be much better if it all worked the same.
fields.summary: Lists not functioning inside of a Table

fields.description:
If I wanted "er" to be bolded in "wibblers", then the following gets used: wibb*er*s

Unfortunatly that dumps out the *'s to screen, and doesnt bold the "er".
fields.summary: Bolding not taking effect
Blank Space on Enclosed {panel}

fields.description:
Although confluence has automatic linking camel-case wiki style, this isn't enough for people who want a more configurable system. Here comes in the idea of keyword mappings.

These are a set of keywords to search for and replace in the pages. These could fit into three scopes:

1. Globally across confluence
2. Specific to a Space
3. Specific to a Page

The first two can be done using administration pages with html forms for specifying the keywords to search for and what to replace them with:

eg. replace "ADAM" with "[ADAM|ADAMDEV:ADAM]"
eg. replace "Confluence" with "[Confluence|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/]"

The third could be done with a macro {AddKeyword} possibly in the following format:

eg. {AddKeyword:ADAM|[ADAM|ADAMDEV:ADAM]}
eg. {AddKeyword:Confluence|[Confluence|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/]}

In this environment, the ability in the 2nd and 3rd scopes to "ignore" keywords would be good. Perhaps in the format {IgnoreKeyword:ADAM}, to remove the keyword mapping. The ignored keyword's would be parsed first, as to allow keyword mappings to be replaced.

eg. {IgnoreKeyword:ADAM}{AddKeyword:ADAM|[ADAM|http://www.bleh.com/adam/]}

If this gets implemented, a personal profile preference option to allow each user to decide if they want linking on a page to happen multiple times - or just on the first occurance.

eg. if the keyword ADAM occurs 50 times in a page, it may be irritating to see it linked over and over. I (via profile preference) or the page author (via another macro?) may wish to set it to link only to the first.

Also, the ability to put in a word that wont be parsed as a keyword ("word escaping" for want of a better term) would be useful.

Other ideas / conceptual enhancements / changes are welcome!

Just a thought ...
fields.summary: Keyword Mappings

fields.description:
The change notifications are creating incorrect links back to the site.  It seems the value of the server base URL in the admin console paths section is not being heeded.

My server base URL is set to "http://v4dev.digitalriver.com/confluence", but the email does not reflect this.  See attached HTML for an example.
fields.summary: Change notification email links do not use full server path

fields.description:
When I try to import a RSS feed as {jiraissues:..} or {rss:..} I get the following ParseException on a red background:

jiraissues: ParseException: Error on line 57: Attribute name "noshade" associated with an element type "HR" must be followed by the ' = ' character.

jiraissues is sometimes replaced by rss ... but the same error occurs. This may be related to CONF-833.
fields.summary: ParseException when trying to use rss / jiraissues macro

fields.description: Currently there is no way to order the undefined pages list, I would want to order by the title most of the time. The ability to reorder the table by various columns would make it alot more user friendly - at least to me.
fields.summary: Ordering in Undefined Pages

fields.description:
In the second the space summary which allows you to list undefined pages, if an undefined page is linked to multiple times, there are multiple rows.

I think, it should group on the Title and Space, and then list the referers all together.

This wouldnt save any space on screen, but it would increase usability / clarity.
fields.summary: Grouping of Titles in Undefined Pages

fields.description:
We are starting to use Confuence quite heavily and one of the things that we would like is that all deleted pages be placed in a 'Recycle Bin, perhaps keyed with the TimeStamp of deletion.

That would be critical to us especially with new users who may do delete pages by mistake.

1) If desired, it could be an admin option to turn the 'Recycle Bin' on flag.
2) There could be a limit on the size of the recycle bin (200 enteries, or perhaps last 30 days).

As a workaround, we have created a page called DELETED and asked all users to place deleted content as a child to that with the timestamp prepended to the title of the page.
fields.summary: Deleted Pages - Need a 'recycle bin'

fields.description:
I have asked confluence to email me changes and Ive got one titled "  [confluence] Confluence Changes in the last 24 hours". The emails I get are in html format.

However, the icons are in relative format - meaning they cant be found (or are incorrect when viewed via webmail as its a different webserver). 

JIRA gets around this issue by asking for a base URL.
fields.summary: Icons being relative in HTML Email Notification
Delegate confluence user management to JIRA

fields.description:
We had a single space become corrupt (can't delete it, can get a list of pages).

This corruption prevented a full backup. One of the spaces has a lot of work done that day.

If the XML space exports are the equivalent of a backup, but only for a space, then it would be good to have a partial backup tool that could act as an emergency backup tool.
- quickly dump multiple spaces
- provide a reload script
fields.summary: Partial (emergency) dump tool

fields.description:
Nice for beta to say "send mail to confluence support"
But for the release could it say send mail to the site admin?

Site admins would really like to know when there is a problem, and if page says send mail to atlassian, the site admin may not know.

Site admins may be the only ones who can package up the information for a bug, especially when that bug prevents a backup.
fields.summary: Error Pages should refer to SITE ADMINSTRATORS

fields.description:
If in a {noformat} block a quote (single or double) is followed by a closing parenthesis the rendered version displays a spurious semicolon inbetween the two. E.g. {noformat}foo("bar"){noformat} is rendered as: 
foo("bar";)
which looks like: foo("bar";) As a workaround I was able to backslash escape the closing parenthesis.
fields.summary: {noformat} renders spurious semicolon

fields.description:
Name: Index
Contents: {index}
fields.summary: Creating a space should create an index page

fields.description: Administrator config
fields.summary: Editable default for new page / space homepage contents

fields.description:
Use bigger icons, explain options better.

Link to edit the space homepage.
fields.summary: Improve UI of "space created" page

fields.description: See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TEST/dvincludedpanel for an example of multiple trackbacks.
fields.summary: Trackbacks seem to be being added multiple times

fields.description: If you have a link [Go to foo|#foo] in a page in the BLAH space, and then move the page into another space, the link will be rewritten as [Go to foo|BLAH:null]
fields.summary: Moving page between space borks #anchor links

fields.description:
Note the ConnectionKeeper and hsqldb.Log threads below, they are not marked as daemon.  Should they be?  As they are, it is not possible to cleanly shutdown the application server because these two threads are not "daemonized".

Full thread dump Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (1.4.2-b28 mixed mode):

"Thread-3" prio=5 tid=0x001708c0 nid=0x18 waiting on condition [e2801000..e28019c8]
        at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.util.ConnectionKeeper.run(ConnectionKeeper.java:71)

"Thread-2" prio=5 tid=0x00746478 nid=0x17 waiting on condition [e2901000..e29019c8]
        at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)
        at org.hsqldb.Log.run(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)

"DestroyJavaVM" prio=5 tid=0x0002f1b0 nid=0x1 waiting on condition [0..ffbed188]

"Signal Dispatcher" daemon prio=10 tid=0x000dd4b0 nid=0x8 waiting on condition [0..0]

"Finalizer" daemon prio=8 tid=0x000d93a0 nid=0x6 in Object.wait() [e5281000..e52819c8]
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
        - waiting on <0xe709de88> (a java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue$Lock)
        at java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue.remove(ReferenceQueue.java:111)
        - locked <0xe709de88> (a java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue$Lock)
        at java.lang.ref.ReferenceQueue.remove(ReferenceQueue.java:127)
        at java.lang.ref.Finalizer$FinalizerThread.run(Finalizer.java:159)

"Reference Handler" daemon prio=10 tid=0x000d7a40 nid=0x5 in Object.wait() [e5381000..e53819c8]
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
        - waiting on <0xe709dda8> (a java.lang.ref.Reference$Lock)
        at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:429)
        at java.lang.ref.Reference$ReferenceHandler.run(Reference.java:115)
        - locked <0xe709dda8> (a java.lang.ref.Reference$Lock)

"VM Thread" prio=5 tid=0x000d6ba8 nid=0x4 runnable

"VM Periodic Task Thread" prio=10 tid=0x000dfb08 nid=0xa waiting on condition
"Suspend Checker Thread" prio=10 tid=0x000dcb48 nid=0x7 runnable
fields.summary: Non-daemon threads prevent clean server shutdown

fields.description:
Administrative permissions will be taken out in mean time from the users in group 'confluence-admin'.
Manifestation:
	After completion of installation of Confluence everything worked fine, but in mean time (e.g. 1-2  days) of being online, the administrative functionality will be disabled.
Reason:
	The association between users and groups will lost because table 'OS_USER_GROUP' will be cleared.
fields.summary: Group bases permissions doesn't works properly

fields.description:
Confluence failed to send daily notification with digest of changes, when user select a text format for email.
Reason: template for such format doesn't exist - there is no such file 'WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/text/changedigest-notification.vm' .
Stack trace:
2004-02-25 00:00:06,845 ERROR [com.atlassian.confluence.util.VelocityUtils] Error occurred rendering template: /templates/email/text/changedigest-notification.vm

fields.description: It would be useful if you could move an entire hierarchy of pages (page plus all children and their descendents) from space to space. That way you could prepare, say "Version x.y Documentation" in a closed space,  then move the whole bundle across when the version is released.
fields.summary: Move page hierarchy

fields.description:
- Created instance backup on 1.0RC3.
- Downloaded and unpacked 1.0RC5.
- Database was clean (no confluence tables), proceeded to go through installation screens again.
- Got the attached error screen when trying to restore with previous backup file.  Server log attached also.

This raises a question for me about what the proper upgrade process is.  Did I upgrade the intended way?
fields.summary: Restoring data during upgrade to 1.0RC5 results in NPE

fields.description:
I was working with a new user, and they wanted to edit their comments. Users should be able to edit their own comments.

At present, the only way to do this is a delete, and add.

Not urgent, but just an observation from user testing. 
Users make mistakes. 
No way to recover formatting done in a comment.
fields.summary: Editable comments

fields.description: The setup screen for entering your license key has a big red warning at the bottom saying there's a problem with your license. This could be a trifle confusing.
fields.summary: Licensing error appears on 'enter licence' screen

fields.description:
We have several spaces that are visible only to users in specific groups, but they show up in searches by anyone.

I went to our Confluence as an unregistered user and did a search for "a*".  That returned a list of virtually every page on the server including title, space name, *and* a summary of the contents.
fields.summary: Search results include restricted spaces

fields.description:
When exporting the space in HTML, the "posted by" is close to separator line (IE6 used to view and print). During a meeting,  kept on associating the wrong poster with the comment.

One way to solve this would be to put a border around the comment.
Second would be more whitespace between posted by, and separator line.
fields.summary: Border around comments

fields.description: E.g. we have a feature in JIRA: 'Support <select> tag'. If it's in the jiraiisues list - it renders it as combobox, not as text.
fields.summary: Jira issues macro doesn't render correct title if it includes html tag
Link Straight to edit page

fields.description:
I'm having trouble coming up with meaningful diff's with confluence. Try the following:

1) Create new page with two paragraphs of text, save.
2) Start editing, remove one word in the first paragraph, add one to the second.
3) Diff the versions

The diff claims both paragraphs of text have been removed in entirety and new paragraphs have been added. Strangely it visualizes the one word changes in the removed paragraphs.

See the following as a sample

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=1455&originalId=1456

Other sample would be 1) Create a page with 10 lines and save, 2) Change one word in five random lines, 3) Diff - you get a report that the changed lines have been removed and new lines have been inserted in their place with no "this word was removed / added" diffs at all.
fields.summary: Improve diff display of minor changes within a line

fields.description:
Looks like Confluence has some problems with French characters.

I have used French characters in my Full Name and 'Information about me:' and they are not rendered properly.

Using http://confluence.atlassian.com now at rc5
fields.summary: Encoding Problems

fields.description:
It'd be nice to be able to gate blog posts to mail, for example we could make Confluence announcements as blog-posts on the DOC space, and then they'd be automatically forwarded to the mailing-list.

I suppose you could do that now with watches, but it'd be a bit clumsy.

fields.description:
General Configuration radio buttons:

User email addresses are:
[x] public        [ ] masked (i.e. user at example dot com)  [ ] private

Note: Users in the confluence-admin group will have their addresses shown on the Administrators page regardless, if "private" is selected, the administrator addresses will still be masked.

Think we could slip this in quickly today for the JetBrains guys? Should be pretty simple.
fields.summary: Mask/hide email preference

fields.description:
"Enter username" and "Enter password" should be "Choose a username" and "Choose a password", respectively.

"Enter" implies they have one already.
fields.summary: Wording on signup page

fields.description: Currently an import pulls every page from snipsnap database into a space.  It would be great if one could select which pages are imported.
fields.summary: Allow user to select what pages are imported from snipsnap

fields.description:
Suppose you're using some invalid characters in a link name (the page still does not exist) and getting a "create-page" link. You CAN NOT create any page using that link since the title used there is not valid and on the other hand the title is LOCKED in link/page creation process so you can rename it...

Maybe the best way is not to generate any page-creation link when the page/link title is not valid. Another solution can be so that the page title is NOT locked when the title is not valid!
Any better idea?
fields.summary: Page(link) creation process & the invalid characters in page title!

fields.description:
I should be able to search the site and narrow the results by defining different scopes or searching within specific scopes. Scopes like:
* Within a space
* Within the orphan pages (of a specific space or whole the site)
* Within the undefined pages (of a specific space or whole the site)
* Comments
* Attachments

No need to mention that the above scopes can be used in any combinations :-)
fields.summary: Scope-base searches (on-site and via {search} macro)!

fields.description:
I've just put the whole idea here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/CVS+Report+Macro
fields.summary: "CVS Report" macro

fields.description:
I just received the email report of changes in the last 24 hours, and notice that the number of comments on a topic is incorrect. 

Report says:  Jira vs. TestTrackPro has 2 new comments 

When in actuallity, the number is only 1.

I think this may be due to a removal/repost - here are the steps I took.

# Earlier today I read the topic: Jira vs. TestTrackPro
# I made a comment.
# I made a mistake in the comment, and wanted to edit it... but no edit feature(?) so I "REMOVED" the comment.
# I then added the comment again - with the corrections.
# Topic shows my single comment, then, and now, but as stated - the email report says there are 2.

Hope that helps!
Timo

P.S. Wouldn't it be great if JIRA used the same WIKI markup as Confluence? ;-)
fields.summary: Email report shows incorrect # of comments on a topic

fields.description:
The "Last Login" time is not always updated. I tried to logout and login again, but the time dispalyed was my previous login.

The "Signup Date" not my real signup date, but is set to the same time as an login some time ago.
fields.summary: User Statistics in profile is not always uptodate

fields.description:
You can get daily, and monthly blog postings, but one thing that would be a good for projects, weekly summaries. 

We send a weekly status report to mailing list to be archived. It would be nice to have the knowledge tool provide a way for this summary to be created.

Maybe this can be done with rss, but I've never really dug far into it.
fields.summary: Blog Post Summary by Week

fields.description:
This is probably way out there, but would make life so much easier for collaboration.  Essentially most collaboration projects start with a shared network drive and then migrate to an intranet.  I would like to get back to the roots with a WebDAV interface to Confluence so those who feel comfortable browsing a file system and saving files on a "network share" will be able do the same.

Essentially, I see all pages corresponding to folders and any attachments in that folder would appear as files.  Any children would be folders within their parent folder.  This way people can open up documents and edit them and then store them back to confluence without even opening the browser.

Using Jakarta slide and writing a custom backend to the Confluence database is a possible solution.  I think Slide 2.0 has some file versioning built into it (A feature requested already).

This feature would allow for group folders within projects for storing information

Also there should be personal folders (~soandso) so when someone logs into their computer, they're map directly to Confluence.

I'll keep my fingers crossed for this feature in 2.0 :)
fields.summary: WebDAV access to attachments

fields.description:
It would be nice if the {children} macro has parameters to support different sortings.  Right now, it always sorts alphabetically on page title.

Other sortings to support:

 Create date
 Last modification date
 Last modification author (?)
fields.summary: Support different sortings of page children

fields.description: It would nice to add files to a user profile.  This would give users a "home directory" for files that are of interest to them.
fields.summary: Add Attachments to user profile page

fields.description:
We have both JIRA and Confluence running now. I notice that if I log in to one system (JIRA) from my browser, then open another browser window and open the other (Confluence), the user is logged out of the first (even if they are not the same user being logged in). Are both using the same cookie name?
Is the system using cookies? Something else?

Jeff
fields.summary: Confluence / JIRA - logging into both from same browser

fields.description:
Assume a space containing the two pages "Home" and "Foo", where "Foo" contains something like this:

   [Link to myself|Foo]
   [Link to home|Home]

If this space is exported to PDF (both pages are exported), then the first link will point to the URL of the generated URL (for example http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/temp/export_02202004_082449/TEST-20Feb2004-08_24_49.pdf) and the second link will point to an URL of a NOT exported HTML page (e.g. http://confluence.atlassian.com/download/temp/export_02202004_082449/Home.html).

In any case I think it's wrong to point to the area where the temporary export artifacts are created, as the document isn't very portable that way.

So what should the links point to?  Here some thoughts: The export mechanism has to decide whether the links should point to resources inside the exported artifact (i.e. to other parts within the PDF) or to the source artifacts (i.e. the URLs of the pages in Confluence).  Which of these approaches is more appropriate?  Should it be a user option?  If the links point to the source artifacts, should they point to the version current at the time of export?

Observation: Anchor links seem to point to the respective parts within the exported PDF.
fields.summary: Inter-page links in exported PDF wrong

fields.description: Please provide documentation of either how to setup a shared user database between Jira and Confluence and/or how to setup the user accounts in each so that it'll be safe to later turn on account sharing and not royally mess up data ownerships.
fields.summary: Provide documentation about shared user database (Jira+Confluence)

fields.description:
Entering this as a metaissue which'll probably be linked to a bunch of smaller issues. :)

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DISC/JIRA+Integration

I'd love to see this put somewhere into the Confluence roadmap (1.2?), get a comment on what type of integration you expect to implement and in what timeframe.
fields.summary: JIRA integration

fields.description: If you sign up as a new user, the editor of the profile page should be the user who registered, right?
fields.summary: Signing up creates user profile page with Anonymous editor

fields.description:
The Recent Changes box currently cannot be disabled. Hence it's impossible to create accounts who don't have information about who are the other users of the Confluence instance since everyone sees the recent changes of the user pages. Please make it possible to configure which groups can view the recent changes of the user pages.

I'd like to enable Confluence to be used as an "extranet" type solution where I can publish documents to groups of users who might not have access to information of the other groups.
fields.summary: Configurable permissions for Recent Changes

fields.description:
A page containing something like:

   Are [spaces|Home] [between|Home] links maintained in PDF?

Is rendered as:

   Are spacesbetween links maintained in PDF?

Of course all of the "spacesbetween" characters are blue and underlines.  But the space inbetween in missing.  Note that it doesn't matter whether there are multiple spaces inbetween or the links point to different pages.
fields.summary: PDF export does not maintain spaces between links

fields.description: Make it possible to disable creating new accounts by end users - essentially the same setup as Jira Private mode.
fields.summary: Private setup

fields.description: Authoring a topic with images is difficult. It needs to be improved. An easy improvement would be to offer a "insert attachment here" button in the edit page. When clicked it would list all the attachement, allowing the user to pick one from the list. Alternatively, all attachements could be listed on the RHS (for example) of the edit page, allowing user to select one. When selected it would be added to the current caret position in the edit box.
fields.summary: Improve insertion of images when editing pages

fields.description:
Entering something like: * noformat inside bullet: {noformat}test{noformat} is rendered as:
  • noformat inside bullet: 
test
Which of course results in the {noformat} enclosed text being rendered outside the box (and bullet). This used to work with version 1.0rc4.
fields.summary: {noformat} inside bullets
Allow Template variables to have types

If you have the {blog-posts} macro for example, icons don't seem to get exported properly.

We need a generic solution so that any images used in macros etc get 'pulled' into the PDF somehow.
fields.summary: Icons and images don't get exported in PDFs

I think this one is something to do with your recent changes mate.

Replication steps:
- create a new page
- click on list pages or "export page -> export space"
  - it's not listed
- now click on the space summary
- click on list pages
  - it is listed

fields.description:
Including:
- getAttachments
- getComments
- RemoteAttachment and RemoteComment

- addSpace

fields.summary: New remote API methods are not documented

fields.description: Currently it only returns "modify" and "view" perms, not "comment" or "admin" (useful as we add more admin and comment functions to the remote API).
fields.summary: Remote API does not incidate space comment or admin perms
Ability to edit default space homepage title and content
Add user management methods to remote API for administrators

fields.description: Only looking back a couple of hours...
fields.summary: Daily Email not picking up all of the changes in a day

fields.description: Gives updates to comments and users now, too.
fields.summary: Make daily email a bit more readable

fields.description:
Confluence is running at http://tomyum:9999/confluence/

putting in http://tomyum:9999/confluence/display/SpaceThatDontExist

gives a blank screen.

After the blank screen go to

http://tomyum:9999/confluence/display

and log in,

it then forwards to http://tomyum:9999/confluence/fourohfour.action

which displays a badly looking page with links to

http://$baseurl/confluence/images/icons/web_16.gif
fields.summary: putting in bogus URL doesnt show 404, later 404 looks unwell

fields.description:
To reproduce: 
1. signup as a new user
2. then click the pages report link on dashboard

Strangely enough, if you are persistent, and re-login (1 or more times) as the same user, the NPE will go away. Maybe that might shed light on the problem.
